answers.answer: How are you? Was there a prostrate surgery done? Retrograde ejaculation can be caused by medications, health conditions or surgeries that affect the nerves or muscle that control the bladder opening. Several conditions can cause this condition such as: surgery in the bladder neck or prostrate, side effect of certain medications (high blood pressure, prostate enlargement and mood disorders); nerve damage caused by a medical condition such as diabetes, multiple sclerosis or a spinal cord injury. Diagnosis is through urinalysis obtained shortly after ejaculation which will show an abnormal level of sperm within it. Retrograde ejaculation does not require treatment unless it interferes with fertility. In these cases, treatment depends on the underlying cause. This link would be of help:http://www.mayoclinic.com/health/retrograde-ejaculation/DS00913It would be best to see your doctor for proper evaluation and management. Take care and keep us posted.

question: My husband siuffered from pain at the groin area for a period of time with occational blood tinged penile secretion and painful intercourse. He received medication for releave of prostatic enlargement and latter the pain revealed but anejaculation is now noticed. Is this course of disorder common what is the suspected cause?
title: retrograde ejaculation
